title: Metallica - Black Album[1991-2001]DVD-A Rip[UKB Flac by D-L33T3]
description:
Metallica - Black Album - DVD-A

Source: Analog rip by macromaggot
Year: 1991/2001
Format: Lossless flac
Sample rate: 96khz
Bits per sample: 24 bit
Channels: 6 ( 5.1 (3/2.1) )

01. Enter sandman
02. Sad but true
03. Holier than thou
04. The unforgiven
05. Whereever I may roam
06. Don't tread on me
07. Through the never
08. Nothing else matters
09. Of wolf and men
10. The god that failed
11. My friend of misery
12. The struggle within

All credit for the analog rip goes to macromaggot. 
I only sorted the channel arangements, encoded it to a more suitable format and tagged it all.
The audio ripped was the MLP 5.1 24/96 element of the DVD-A (from the Audio_ts folder). This is normaly unrippable. ;)

You will need a sound card that supports 24 bit/96 khz audio. Like a soundblaster Live 24bit/Audegy/X-FI.
I advise using Foobar2000 for playback as some players have issues with mulitchannel Flac or things like the high bit depth or sample rate.


Enjoy this HQ audio

-==D-L33T3==-

UKB KVCD Release Group


EDIT: To save the nitpicking.

The official release date for this dvd audio album is supposed to be 2002 however the disk scans clearly show a 2001 copyright...

Thats how theres confusion on the actual date of the rip. My post says 2001 as per the disk but my torrent says 2002.
